intro: Arctium assyriacum, commonly known as the Assyrian burdock, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and distinctive leaf structures. The plant features large, heart-shaped leaves with coarse teeth along the margins. Its flowers are typically purple or pink, arranged in clusters, and it produces burrs with hooked bracts that aid in seed dispersal. Arctium assyriacum is often found in disturbed soils, along roadsides, and in waste areas.
